content.description:
The Land of Thrace

Terra procul vastisvastus, -a, -um, adj. = magnus, -a, -um colitur MavortiaMavortius, -a, -um, adj.: of or belonging to Mars campis 
(ThracesThrax, Thracis, m.: Thracian arantaro, -are: to farm) acri quondamquondam = olim regnataregno, -are, -avi, -atus = rego, -ere LycurgoLycurgus, -i, m.: Lycurgus (a male name), 
hospitiumhospitium, -i, n.: ally antiquum Troiae sociique PenatesPenates, -ium, m. pl.: Penates (household gods) 
dum fortuna fuit.
content.question: According to lines 3-4 (hospitium...fuit), what kind of relationship did the Thracians have with the city of Troy?

choices.label: The Thracians remained neutral in conflicts involving Troy.
The Thracians allied with Troy only on certain matters.
The Thracians were reliable allies to Troy.
The Thracians were hateful to Troy.

content.answer: The Thracians were reliable allies to Troy.

unit.text: 4: Teacher's Choice - Latin Poetry and Vergil's Aeneid, Excerpts from Books 1 and 2
